struct dp_element* cut(int *const array, int array_len, int index, int *out_new_len){

    // array is the current dp array passed in.

    struct dp_element result;

    if (index <1 ) {

        *out_new_len =0;

        return NULL;

    }

    if (index <= array[0].x) {

        // return array with one element.

        struct dp_element *new_arr = (struct dp_element *)malloc(1 * sizeof(struct dp_element));

        new_arr[0].x = index;

        new_arr[0].cnt = array[0].cnt;

        *out_new_len =1;

        return new_arr;

    }

    // need to search from back.

    for(int i = array_len -1; i>0; --i){

        if ( array[i-1].x < index ){

            // yes, can split here.

            // new array is array up to i elements, plus (index, array[i].cnt)

            *out_new_len = i +1;

            struct dp_element *new_arr = (struct dp_element*) malloc( (*out_new_len) * sizeof(struct dp_element));

            memcpy( new_arr, array, (i) * sizeof(struct dp_element));

            new_arr[i].x = index;

            new_arr[i].cnt = array[i].cnt;

            return new_arr;

        }

    }

    // if no for loop found.

    // append at end:

    *out_new_len = array_len +1;

    struct dp_element *new_arr = (struct dp_element *)malloc( *out_new_len * sizeof(struct dp_element) );

    memcpy( new_arr, array, array_len * sizeof(struct dp_element) );

    new_arr[array_len].x = index;

    new_arr[array_len].cnt = array[array_len -1].cnt;

    return new_arr;

}
